12 Excel Shortcuts Every Junior Analyst Should Know

January 8, 2025

12 Excel Shortcuts Every Junior Analyst Should Know ‚å®Ô∏è

If you‚Äôre starting your career as a data or business analyst, Excel will likely be one of your most-used tools.
Mastering keyboard shortcuts can save you hours each week and make you look like a pro in front of your team.

Here are 12 essential Excel shortcuts every junior analyst should have in their toolkit.

1. Ctrl + Shift + L ‚Üí Toggle Filters

Quickly turn filters on or off for your dataset without touching the mouse.

2. Ctrl + Arrow Keys ‚Üí Jump to Data Edges

Navigate instantly to the top, bottom, left, or right edge of your data range.

3. Ctrl + Shift + Arrow Keys ‚Üí Select Data Blocks

Highlight entire columns or rows of data in seconds.

4. Alt + = ‚Üí AutoSum

Insert a SUM formula for the selected range instantly.

5. Ctrl + T ‚Üí Create a Table

Convert your data into a structured table with built-in filtering and formatting.

6. F4 ‚Üí Repeat Last Action

Whether it‚Äôs formatting a cell or inserting a row, F4 repeats your last command.

7. Ctrl + 1 ‚Üí Format Cells

Open the Format Cells dialog to adjust number formats, alignment, borders, and more.

8. Ctrl + ; ‚Üí Insert Today‚Äôs Date

Perfect for timestamping entries without typing.

9. Ctrl + Shift + ‚Äú+‚Äù ‚Üí Insert Row or Column

Quickly add new rows or columns without navigating menus.

10. Ctrl + - ‚Üí Delete Row or Column

Remove selected rows or columns instantly.

11. Ctrl + Space / Shift + Space ‚Üí Select Column or Row

  • Ctrl + Space ‚Üí Select entire column
  • Shift + Space ‚Üí Select entire row

12. Ctrl + Z / Ctrl + Y ‚Üí Undo & Redo

Your safety net for mistakes ‚Äî undo or redo actions instantly.

üí° Pro Tip:

Don‚Äôt try to memorize all 12 at once. Pick 3‚Äì4 shortcuts and use them daily until they become second nature. Then add more to your repertoire.
